# Cursive: Relationship-Centric Knowledge Canvas

Cursive combines handwriting with AI to create a dynamic knowledge canvas. Write naturally, and watch as your notebook comes alive with AI-powered insights and connections.

## Core Features

- **Natural Handwriting Recognition**: Write naturally on a digital canvas with automatic AI transcription
- **Unified Chat-Card System**: Seamlessly interact with your content through either chat or cards on the canvas
- **Relationship-Centric Model**: Focuses on connections between ideas as first-class entities
- **Spatial-Temporal Organization**: Arrange ideas spatially while preserving context and history
- **AI-Powered Insights**: Get intelligent responses to your handwritten notes
- **Collaborative Thinking**: Work together in real-time with multiple perspectives

## NEW: Unified Relationship-Centric Model

The new version of Cursive features a powerful relationship-centric model that puts connections between ideas at the forefront:

### Core Model Structure

The fundamental unit is the relationship triple:

```
{
  "from_node": {
    "content": "text or reference to artifact",
    "type": "question|response|note|drawing"
  },
  "connection": {
    "type": "supports|contradicts|questions|extends|tensions",
    "vector": {
      "direction": "resolving|exploring|deepening",
      "intention": "why this connection exists",
      "state": "active|resolved|abandoned"
    }
  },
  "to_node": {
    "content": "text or reference to artifact",
    "type": "question|response|note|drawing"
  }
}
```

This structure enables:
- **Text-First Operation**: Everything can be created, viewed, and manipulated as text
- **Relationship as Entity**: Connections have their own properties and context
- **Spatial Canvas + Sequential Chat**: Interact through either spatial canvas or chat interface
- **Fully Recursive**: Relationships can connect to other relationships

## Architecture Overview

Cursive is built on three main technologies:
1. **Next.js**: Frontend framework and API routes
2. **Supabase**: Database, authentication, and real-time functionality
3. **Claude AI**: Handwriting recognition and conversational capabilities

### Canvas System

The canvas is built using Konva.js and consists of several layers:
- **DrawingLayer**: Handles pen strokes and eraser functionality
- **ThreadsLayer**: Manages thread cards and their interactions
- **ConnectionLayer**: Renders visual connections between related threads
- **UnifiedCardThread**: Represents both chat messages and canvas cards

### Relationship Model

The relationship model organizes content into a connected network:
- **Nodes**: Questions, responses, notes, and drawings
- **Relationships**: Connections between nodes with rich properties
- **Vectors**: Directional properties of relationships showing intention and state

// Improved color selector for better touch support
interface ColorSelectorProps {
  selectedColor: string;
  onChange: (color: string) => void;
}

const CompactColorSelector: React.FC<ColorSelectorProps> = ({
  selectedColor,
  onChange
}) => {
  const [isOpen, setIsOpen] = useState(false);
  const menuRef = useRef<HTMLDivElement>(null);
  
  // Color options - limited palette for quick selection
  const colors = [
    { color: '#000000', name: 'Black' },
    { color: '#2563EB', name: 'Blue' },
    { color: '#DC2626', name: 'Red' },
    { color: '#16A34A', name: 'Green' },
    { color: '#7C3AED', name: 'Purple' },
    { color: '#F59E0B', name: 'Orange' },
    { color: '#5D5D5D', name: 'Gray' },
    { color: '#831843', name: 'Pink' },
  ];
  
  // Close menu when clicking outside
  useEffect(() => {
    const handleClickOutside = (event: MouseEvent) => {
      if (menuRef.current && !menuRef.current.contains(event.target as Node)) {
        setIsOpen(false);
      }
    };
    
    document.addEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
    return () => {
      document.removeEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
    };
  }, []);
  
  return (
    <div className="relative inline-block" ref={menuRef} onClick={(e) => e.stopPropagation()}>
      <button
        className="flex items-center justify-center w-7 h-7 rounded-full border border-gray-300 shadow-sm focus:outline-none"
        style={{ backgroundColor: selectedColor }}
        onClick={() => setIsOpen(!isOpen)}
        aria-label="Select color"
      />
      
      {isOpen && (
        <div className="absolute bottom-full left-0 mb-1 p-1 bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg border border-gray-200 z-40 flex flex-wrap w-36">
          {colors.map(({ color, name }) => (
            <button
              key={color}
              className={`w-8 h-8 m-0.5 rounded-full border hover:shadow-md ${color === selectedColor ? 'ring-2 ring-blue-500' : ''}`}
              style={{ backgroundColor: color }}
              onClick={() => {
                onChange(color);
                setIsOpen(false);
              }}
              title={name}
              aria-label={`Select ${name} color`}
            />
          ))}
        </div>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

      // Close more menu if clicked outside
      if (moreMenuRef.current && !moreMenuRef.current.contains(event.target as Node)) {
        setMoreMenuOpen(false);
      }
      
      // Close tool options if clicked outside
      if (toolOptionsRef.current && !toolOptionsRef.current.contains(event.target as Node)) {
        setToolOptionsOpen(null);
      }
    };
    
    document.addEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
    return () => {
      document.removeEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
    };
  }, []);
  
  // Handle tool selection
  const handleToolSelect = useCallback((newTool: Tool) => {
    console.log(`Changing tool from ${tool} to ${newTool}`);
    setTool(newTool);

    // Close the more menu if open
    setMoreMenuOpen(false);

    // If selecting the same tool that's already active, toggle tool options
    if (newTool === tool) {
      setToolOptionsOpen(toolOptionsOpen === newTool ? null : newTool);
    } else {
      // If selecting a different tool, close current tool options and open new ones
      setToolOptionsOpen(newTool);
    }

    // If changing to pen, reset the view if zoomed out too much
    if (newTool === 'pen' && scale < 0.5) {
      setScale(0.5);
    }
  }, [tool, setTool, scale, setScale, toolOptionsOpen]);

  // Setup click handler on canvas to close tool options
  useEffect(() => {
    if (!toolOptionsOpen) return;

    // Add event listener to canvas element
    const handleCanvasClick = (event: Event) => {
      const canvasElement = document.querySelector('.konvajs-content');
      if (canvasElement && canvasElement.contains(event.target as Node)) {
        setToolOptionsOpen(null);
      }
    };

    document.addEventListener('mousedown', handleCanvasClick);
    document.addEventListener('touchstart', handleCanvasClick);

    return () => {
      document.removeEventListener('mousedown', handleCanvasClick);
      document.removeEventListener('touchstart', handleCanvasClick);
    };
  }, [toolOptionsOpen]);
  
  // Reset view (zoom and position)
  const resetView = useCallback(() => {
    setScale(1);
    setPosition({ x: 0, y: 0 });
    setMoreMenuOpen(false);
  }, [setScale, setPosition]);
  
  // Handle zoom buttons
  const zoomIn = useCallback(() => {
    setScale(Math.min(scale * 1.1, 5)); // Max zoom 5x
  }, [scale, setScale]);
  
  const zoomOut = useCallback(() => {
    setScale(Math.max(scale / 1.1, 0.2)); // Min zoom 0.2x
  }, [scale, setScale]);

  const updateTitle = useCallback(async () => {
    try {

        .eq('id', notebookId);

      titleInputRef.current?.select();
    }, 0);
  }, []);
  
  // Handle title input keydown
  const handleTitleKeyDown = useCallback((e: React.KeyboardEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    if (e.key === 'Enter') {
      updateTitle();
    } else if (e.key === 'Escape') {
      setTitle(notebookTitle);
      setEditingTitle(false);
    }
  }, [updateTitle, notebookTitle]);
  
  // Export as PNG
  const exportAsPNG = useCallback(async () => {
    try {
      // Find the container element
      const stageContainer = document.querySelector('.konvajs-content') as HTMLElement;

      // Generate PNG
      const dataUrl = await toPng(stageContainer);
      
      // Create download link
      const link = document.createElement('a');
      link.download = `${title.replace(/\s+/g, '-').toLowerCase()}.png`;
      link.href = dataUrl;
      link.click();
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('Error exporting as PNG:', err);
      alert('Error exporting as PNG');
    }
  }, [title]);
  
  // Export as PDF

    try {
      // Find the container element
      const stageContainer = document.querySelector('.konvajs-content') as HTMLElement;
      if (!stageContainer) return;
      
      // Generate PNG
      const dataUrl = await toPng(stageContainer);
      
      // Create PDF
      const pdf = new jsPDF({
        orientation: 'landscape',
        unit: 'px',
        format: [stageContainer.offsetWidth, stageContainer.offsetHeight],
      });
      
      pdf.addImage(dataUrl, 'PNG', 0, 0, stageContainer.offsetWidth, stageContainer.offsetHeight);
      pdf.save(`${title.replace(/\s+/g, '-').toLowerCase()}.pdf`);

  const [notebook, setNotebook] = useState<Notebook | null>(null);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const [error, setError] = useState<Error | null>(null);
  const { user } = useAuth();

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!notebookId) {
      setLoading(false);
      return;
    }

    const fetchNotebook = async () => {
      try {
        setLoading(true);
        
        // For demo mode without authentication
        if (!user) {
          console.log("Demo mode - creating in-memory notebook");
          
          // Create a fake notebook for the demo
          const demoNotebook = {
            id: notebookId,
            title: "Demo Notebook",
            description: "This is a demo notebook (not saved to database)",
            user_id: '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000',
            folder_id: null,
            is_public: true,
            is_collaborative: false,
            share_id: 'demo-share-id',
            system_prompt: null,
            created_at: new Date().toISOString(),
            updated_at: new Date().toISOString()
          };
          
          setNotebook(demoNotebook);
          return;
        }
        
        // For authenticated users, fetch from Supabase
        const { data, error } = await supabase
          .from('notebooks')
          .select('*')
          .eq('id', notebookId)
          .single();
          
        if (error) {
          throw error;
        }
        
        // Check if user has access to this notebook
        // Users have access if they:
        // 1. Are the owner, or
        // 2. The notebook is public, or
        // 3. The notebook is collaborative
        if (data && (data.user_id === user.id || data.is_public || data.is_collaborative)) {
          setNotebook(data);
        } else {
          setNotebook(null);
          setError(new Error('You do not have access to this notebook'));
        }
      } catch (err) {
        console.error('Error fetching notebook:', err);
        setError(err instanceof Error ? err : new Error('An unknown error occurred'));
        setNotebook(null);
      } finally {
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };

    fetchNotebook();
    
    // Set up a real-time subscription for updates (only for authenticated users)
    if (user) {
      const notebookSubscription = supabase
        .channel(`notebook:${notebookId}`)
        .on('postgres_changes', {
          event: 'UPDATE',
          schema: 'public',
          table: 'notebooks',
          filter: `id=eq.${notebookId}`,
        }, (payload) => {
          setNotebook(payload.new as Notebook);
        })
        .subscribe();
        
      return () => {
        supabase.removeChannel(notebookSubscription);
      };
    }
  }, [notebookId, user?.id, user]);

  // Create a new notebook
  const createNotebook = async (title: string, description?: string): Promise<Notebook | null> => {
    if (!user) return null;
    
    try {
      const { data, error } = await supabase
        .from('notebooks')
        .insert({
          title,
          description,
          user_id: user.id,
          is_public: false,
          is_collaborative: false,
        })
        .select()
        .single();
        
      if (error) {
        throw error;
      }
      
      return data;
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('Error creating notebook:', err);
      return null;
    }
  };
  
  // Update the notebook
  const updateNotebook = async (
    updates: Partial<Omit<Notebook, 'id' | 'user_id' | 'created_at' | 'updated_at'>>
  ): Promise<boolean> => {
    if (!notebook || !user) return false;
    
    try {
      const { error } = await supabase
        .from('notebooks')
        .update(updates)
        .eq('id', notebook.id)
        .eq('user_id', user.id);
        
      if (error) {
        throw error;
      }
      
      // We don't need to update state here as it will come through the subscription
      return true;
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('Error updating notebook:', err);
      return false;
    }
  };
  
  // Delete the notebook
  const deleteNotebook = async (): Promise<boolean> => {
    if (!notebook || !user) return false;
    
    try {
      // Delete all related data first
      await supabase
        .from('conversations')
        .delete()
        .eq('notebook_id', notebook.id);
        
      await supabase
        .from('strokes')
        .delete()
        .eq('notebook_id', notebook.id);
      
      // Then delete the notebook
      const { error } = await supabase
        .from('notebooks')
        .delete()
        .eq('id', notebook.id)
        .eq('user_id', user.id);
        
      if (error) {
        throw error;
      }
      
      return true;
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('Error deleting notebook:', err);
      return false;
    }
  };

  return {
    notebook,
    loading,
    error,
    createNotebook,
    updateNotebook,
    deleteNotebook,
  };
